sn5.9:4.2: Then the nun Selā got dressed in the morning …
sn5.9:4.3: and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
sn5.9:4.4: Then Māra the Wicked, wanting to make the nun Selā feel fear, terror, and goosebumps …
sn5.9:6.2: “Who’s speaking this verse, a human or a non-human?”
sn5.9:6.4: “This is Māra the Wicked, wanting to make me feel fear, terror, and goosebumps, wanting to make me fall away from convergence!”
sn5.9:6.5: Then Selā, knowing that this was Māra the Wicked, replied to him in verse:
sn5.9:7.2: nor is this misery made by another.
sn5.9:7.3: It comes to be because of a cause,
sn5.9:7.4: and ceases when the cause breaks up.
sn5.9:8.1: It’s like a seed that’s sown
sn5.9:8.3: relying on both the soil’s nutrition
sn5.9:9.1: In the same way the aggregates and elements
sn5.9:9.3: come to be because of a cause,
sn5.9:9.4: and cease when the cause breaks up.”
sn5.9:10.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The nun Selā knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
